name: energy-material transition model v20
description: Changes to V19: calculation of energy investments set on base and additional materials, not materials as a fraction of a total

elements.name: C-H_inLitS
elements.description: Carbon store in lithosphere (i.e. fossil fuels), expressed in m_CO2 in Gt. Initial value corresponds to know reserves and estimated resources (Kausch et al. 2011)

elements.name: CO2_inAtm&UpperOcean
elements.description: Cumulative CO2 emission since 1850 remaining in atmosphere and upper ocean. Atmosphere and upper ocean are in short term and constant exchange, therefore both stocks are coupled and for simplicity combined.

elements.name: CO2_toAtmS
elements.description: Release from lithosphere to atmosphere by burning fossil fuels (i.e. fC)

behavior.value: [conv_fC]+[process CO2 emissions from materials]

elements.name: P_to society
elements.description: Power supply to society (flow)

behavior.value: [E_Technosphere]/TimeStep()

elements.name: E_Technosphere
elements.description: Technosphere represents the energy grid, collecting and distributing power to where it is needed. It does not have a storing-function, but is used as a summation for all power inputs and outputs

elements.name: E_fC
elements.description:
Embodied energy in fossil conversion engine existing at the beginning of the simulation.
P_output (2026) = 6.24 TW (coal, oil, gas, nuclear; -> Desing et al. (2019); electricity, heat and transport all converted to electricity; each are assumed to be ~1/3)
fC_EPBT = 3a (https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld200304/ldselect/ldsctech/126/12620.htm)
LF_fC = 0.5 for electric energy (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capacity_factor; https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=22832, Desing and Widmer 2021)

If all was electricity:
E_fC = P_demand / LF_fC * fC_EPBT = 38.4 TWa

Considering 1/3 is electricity with a LF = 0.5; 2/3 is with LF=1;
E_fC = P_demand * fC_EPBT *(0.6 + 0.4/LF_fC) = 26.63 TWa

elements.description: power of EoL from newly built fC

elements.name: P_nomfC
elements.description:
Nominal Power of the machine expressed as the embedded energy divided by the energy payback time i.e. fC_EPBT

The nominal power is the maximum supply the machine can provide

behavior.value: ([E_fC]+[E_fCnew])/[fC_EPBT]

elements.name: P_nomPV
elements.description:
Nominal Power of the machine expressed as the embedded energy divided by the energy payback time i.e. PV_EPBT

The nominal power is the maximum output the machine can provide. This is not to be mistaken as peak power of PV, which refers to laboratory conditions. The nominal power is the output that can be generated at specific locations in real installations, i.e. the yearly possible energy yield without curtailment divided by the time of the year.

[P nom PV 2]+[P nom PV 1]

elements.name: independence time
elements.description:
Time that the storage allows to be independent of the PV power supply.
To level out daily variation: ~14.5h (0.0016a)
To level out seasonal variation: 84h (at 0째N/S;0.01a); 500h (20째N/S; 0.06a), 1183h (40째N/S; 0.13a), 2666h (60째N/S; 0.3a) assuming constant demand throughout the year. https://beyondthisbriefanomaly.org/2015/08/30/an-integrated-view-of-energy-transition-what-can-we-learn/

elements.name: fraction of daily demand stored
elements.description: denotes the fraction of daily power demand that needs to be provided through storage. Current demand patterns require between 0.4 and 0.6, while aligning demand with solar supply can reduce this fraction towards zero (Desing et al. 2021).

elements.name: storage roundtrip efficiency
elements.description: output energy from storage / input energy into storage

behavior.value:
1/([fraction electro-chemical storage]/[roundtrip efficiency electro-chemical storage]+[fraction mechanical storage]/[roundtrip efficiency mechanical storage]+[fraction  chemical storage]/[roundtrip efficiency chemical storage])
#[roundtrip efficiency electro-chemical storage]*[fraction electro-chemical storage]+[roundtrip efficiency mechanical storage]*[fraction mechanical storage]+[roundtrip efficiency chemical storage]*[fraction  chemical storage]

elements.name: fraction of power stored
elements.description: represents the fraction of power demand which needs to be provided through storage. It comprises the fraction of daily demand stored and the fraction of power stored to level out seasonal variations. The latter is calculated as a function of independence time and the maximum fraction of power stored for seasonal variations, i.e. a linear increase with independence time until the maximum fraction is reached for full independence (i.e. independence time = 0.3a)

behavior.value:
If [independence time]>{0.0016 Years} Then
    [fraction of daily demand stored] +[maximum fraction of power stored for seasonal variations]*([independence time]-{0.0016 Years})/{0.3 Years}
Else
    [fraction of daily demand stored]
End If

elements.name: storage loss coefficient
elements.description:
storage losses have to be provided in addition to power demand.
P_opPV = P_demand * (1+ fraction of power stored * (1/roundtrip efficiency -1)

behavior.value: [fraction of power stored]*(1/[storage roundtrip efficiency]-1)

elements.name: energy intensity electro-chemical storage
elements.description: embodied electric energy / storage capacity for electro-chemical storage , i.e. batteries. E.g. for Li-Ion NMC111: 457, NMC811: 323, NCA: 339 (Crenna et al. 2020, Desing et al. 2021)

elements.name: roundtrip efficiency electro-chemical storage
elements.description: For Li-Ion batteries: output energy from storage / input energy into storage = 0.94 (Desing and WIdmer 2022)

elements.name: energy intensity mechanical storage
elements.description: embodied electric energy / storage capacity for mechanical storage technologies. E.g. pumped hydro storage: EI=85 (Desing et al. 2021)

elements.name: roundtrip efficiency mechanical storage
elements.description: For pumped hydro storage: output energy from storage / input energy into storage = 0.75 (Desing et al. 2021)

elements.name: energy intensity chemical storage
elements.description: embodied electric energy / storage capacity for chemical storage, i.e. synthetic fuels. E.g. PEM electrolyzer to make H2 from H2O and methanization with CO2 from DAC to CH4: EI=60 (Zhang et al. 2017, Desing et al. 2021)

elements.name: roundtrip efficiency chemical storage
elements.description: For synthetic CH4: output energy from storage / input energy into storage = 0.21 (Desing and Widmer 2022)

elements.name: fraction mechanical storage
elements.description: scaling relative weights so that sum over all storage technologies equals 1; if all relative weights are zero, all storage technologies are given equal shares.

behavior.value:
If [sum weights]=0 Then
    1/3
Else
    [relative weight mechanical storage]/[sum weights]
End If

elements.name: fraction electro-chemical storage
elements.description: scaling relative weights so that sum over all storage technologies equals 1; if all relative weights are zero, all storage technologies are given equal shares.

behavior.value:
If [sum weights]=0 Then
    1/3
Else
    [relative weight electro-chemical storage]/[sum weights]
End If

elements.name: fraction  chemical storage
elements.description: scaling relative weights so that sum over all storage technologies equals 1; if all relative weights are zero, all storage technologies are given equal shares.

behavior.value:
If [sum weights]=0 Then
    1/3
Else
    [relative weight chemical storage]/[sum weights]
End If

elements.name: required storage capacity
elements.description: Storage capacity depends on the demand that needs to be stored for the period of the independence time enlarged by the output losses.

behavior.value: [fraction of power stored]*[P_demand]*[independence time]/[storage output efficiency]

elements.name: PV vs storage energy intensity
elements.description:
relationship between energy intensity of PV and energy intensity of storage, or in other words, for each unit of energy invested in PV, how much energy needs to be invested in corresponding storage?
EPBT_PV / (EI storage * independence time)

behavior.value:
If [independence time]={0 a} Then
    0
Else
    [EPBT_PV]/([storage energy intensity]*[independence time])
End If

elements.name: relative weight mechanical storage
